MVAU Parameter Generation file (gen_mvau_defn.py)

Author(s): Syed Asad Alam syed.as[xxx]ad.alam@tcd[xxx].ie

This file generates a parameter file to be used by the test benches. It contains a number of write commands to a file

This material is based upon work supported, in part, by Science Foundation Ireland, www.sfi.ie under Grant No. 13/RC/2094_P2 and, in part, by the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Sklodowska-Curie grant agreement Grant No.754489.  #

Functions
gen_mvau_defn
def gen_mvau_defn(
kdim,
iwl,
iwb,
ifmc,
ofmc,
ifmd,
wwl,
wwb,
op_sgn,
owl,
simd,
pe,
mmv,
stride = 1
)

This function takes in a number of parameters and generates the parameter file based on them.

Parameters
kdim

Kernel dimension.

iwl

Input activation word length.

iwb

'1' if input word length '1' bit, else '0'.

ifmc

Number of input feature map channels.

ofmc

Number of output feature map channels.

wwl

Weight precision.

wwb

'1' if weights are '1' bit, else '0'

owl

Output activation word length

simd

Number of SIMD elements

pe

Number of processing elements (PE)

mmv

Number of images

stride

Convolution stride

Returns

None

parser
def parser()

This function defines an ArgumentParser object for command line arguments

Returns

Parser object (parser)

__main__
if __name__ == "__main__"

Entry point of the file, retrieves the command line arguments and calls the gen_mvau_defn function with the required arguments
